page.title: 02DEVELOPMENT OF RED HOUSES
page.content: Where Red Houses is now, less than twenty years ago the only buildings standing in this area were those clustered around Red Houses itself. This included a farm. Since then three large housing estates have been built in the surroundings. The first was Les Quennevais around 1964 and about this time also Clos Des Sables was being built. Before these, large areas were just sand dunes all the way down to St Ouen's Bay. Once these two estates had been built the area became populated and since it was a success they built another housing estate, Don Farm, a bit further up the airport road. At this time the Communicare Centre was also built. So this part of the west of the island is now quite densely populated. Written by Martin Monamy.
